title: UrbanEdge
description: UrbanEdge is a city planning tool that aggregates public data to inform infrastructure projects.
introduction: UrbanEdge is an innovative platform designed to streamline city planning by leveraging public data. By providing actionable insights, it empowers urban planners and policymakers to make informed decisions for sustainable infrastructure development.

sections.title: Motivation
sections.body: The motivation behind UrbanEdge stems from the need for more data-driven decision-making in urban planning. Traditional methods often rely on limited datasets, leading to inefficiencies. By aggregating public data from various sources, UrbanEdge aims to provide a comprehensive view of urban needs, enabling better resource allocation and project planning.

sections.title: Prototype Development
sections.body: The initial prototype of UrbanEdge focused on integrating data from transportation, population, and environmental sources. Challenges included ensuring data compatibility and accuracy. Solutions involved implementing robust data cleaning algorithms and creating a user-friendly interface for easy navigation.

sections.title: Data Integration
sections.body: Integrating diverse public datasets was a significant challenge. We overcame this by developing a modular data ingestion system that standardizes data formats. This approach allowed for seamless integration of new data sources as they became available.

sections.title: User Feedback and Iteration
sections.body: After releasing the prototype, we gathered feedback from urban planners and policymakers. Key insights led to the development of interactive visualizations and customizable reporting features. These enhancements improved the tool's usability and relevance to end-users.

sections.title: Current Features and Future Plans
sections.body: UrbanEdge currently offers real-time data aggregation, predictive analytics, and scenario modeling. Future plans include expanding the range of data sources, enhancing predictive capabilities with AI, and developing a mobile application for on-the-go access.
